intro: Hedysarum chalchorum, commonly known as yellow peavine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial vine that produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in the spring. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and has the ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native range.
